episodeTitle: The Battle against the Big Tiger! Who is Going to be Captain?!
episodeTitleJapanese: 大虎との決戦！船長になるのは誰だ！
episodeTitleRomanized: Ōtora to no Kessen! Senchō ni Naru no wa Dare da!
description: Ace, Sabo, and Luffy help Naguri make a pirate ship and face off against a fearsome tiger together. After defeating the tiger through teamwork, they struggle to decide who should be captain, ultimately agreeing that all three contributed equally.

events.title: Naguri's Flashback to Gol D. Roger
events.description: Naguri has a flashback to his past battle with Gol D. Roger. Despite being defeated, Roger spared Naguri and his entire crew, an act of mercy that earned Naguri's eternal respect for the Pirate King.
events.significance: This flashback reveals Roger's merciful nature and his honor even in battle. It also serves as a catalyst for exploring Ace's complex feelings about being the son of the Pirate King, as Ace doesn't understand why Naguri would respect the man who defeated him.

quotes.text: I don't understand why you'd respect a man who separated you from your crew!
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace's conflicted feelings about his father Roger

events.title: Ace Challenges Naguri
events.description: Angered by Naguri's respect for Gol D. Roger, Ace challenges the old pirate to a duel. After a brief battle, Ace loses, and he, along with Sabo and Luffy, become Naguri's apprentices.
events.significance: This moment shows Ace's internal struggle with his heritage and his determination to prove himself. It also establishes the three brothers' training relationship with Naguri.

events.title: Building the Pirate Ship
events.description: Ace, Sabo, and Luffy spend time helping Naguri build a pirate ship while training under his guidance. This montage shows their growth and teamwork as they learn the practical skills of piracy.
events.significance: This moment emphasizes the brotherhood between the three boys and their shared dream of becoming pirates. It also shows their willingness to learn and work together.

events.title: The Tiger Battle Begins
events.description: The three brothers decide to challenge the fearsome tiger they encountered in previous episodes. They devise a plan to use their combined strengths to defeat it.
events.significance: This is a defining moment that tests the brothers' teamwork and showcases each of their unique abilities working in harmony.

quotes.text: Let's take down that tiger together!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

events.title: Combo Attack: Gomu Gomu no Rocket Slingshot
events.description: The brothers execute their plan: Sabo distracts the tiger while Luffy uses his Gomu Gomu no Mi powers to create a giant slingshot. Ace crouches into the slingshot, and Luffy launches him forward with a Gomu Gomu no Rocket motion, allowing Ace to deliver the finishing blow to the tiger.
events.significance: This is one of the first major displays of the three brothers working together as a cohesive unit, using each of their unique abilities. It foreshadows Luffy's future tendency to create combination attacks with his crew.

events.title: Tiger Defeated
events.description: With the combined effort of all three brothers, Ace delivers the final blow and defeats the tiger. The victory is a testament to their teamwork and growing strength.
events.significance: The tiger's defeat represents the brothers' growth and their ability to overcome challenges together. It reinforces the theme that their strength comes from their bond.

events.title: No One is Captain
events.description: After the victory, the brothers debate who should be captain. Ace ultimately decides that since all three of them contributed equally to defeating the tiger, no one is officially the captain. They are equals.
events.significance: This moment emphasizes the egalitarian nature of their brotherhood and their mutual respect. It shows that their bond isn't about hierarchy but about equality and shared dreams.

quotes.text: All three of us helped to defeat the tiger, so no one is officially the captain!
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace's declaration of equality among the brothers

events.title: Naguri Departs
events.description: Having completed his pirate ship with the help of the three brothers, Naguri sets sail and departs from Gray Terminal, leaving the boys with valuable lessons about piracy and honor.
events.significance: Naguri's departure marks the end of this training period for the brothers. His influence and teachings will stay with them as they continue their journey.

events.title: Bluejam Locates Sabo
events.description: The episode ends with Bluejam telling his crewmates to inform Sabo's father that they have found him. This ominous development sets up the coming tragedy.
events.significance: This cliffhanger moment foreshadows the impending crisis that will separate the brothers and lead to significant tragedy. It sets up the next arc's conflict involving Sabo's noble family and the Gray Terminal fire.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the equal and egalitarian nature of the relationship between Ace, Sabo, and Luffy. Their decision that no one should be captain shows that their bond is built on mutual respect rather than hierarchy.
themes.symbolism: The tiger battle represents their ability to overcome challenges through teamwork and unity.

themes.description: Ace's reaction to Naguri's respect for Gol D. Roger highlights his ongoing struggle with his father's legacy and his desire to forge his own identity.
themes.symbolism: Ace's anger at Roger's name represents his internal conflict about being the son of the Pirate King.

themes.description: The brothers' coordinated attack on the tiger showcases the power of working together and using each person's unique strengths.
themes.symbolism: The combination attack foreshadows Luffy's future tendency to create strategic team attacks with the Straw Hat Pirates.

themes.description: Building the pirate ship with Naguri represents the boys' shared dream of becoming pirates and sailing the seas.
themes.symbolism: The ship construction symbolizes building their future and working toward their goals.

characterSpotlights.development: Ace grapples with his feelings about his father Gol D. Roger and demonstrates leadership by declaring all three brothers equal. His internal conflict about Roger's legacy is explored.
keyActions: Challenges Naguri to a duel out of anger about Roger
Delivers the final blow to the tiger
Declares that all three brothers are equal, no one is captain
quotes: I don't understand why you'd respect a man who separated you from your crew!
All three of us helped to defeat the tiger, so no one is officially the captain!

characterSpotlights.development: Young Luffy demonstrates his Devil Fruit creativity and his enthusiasm for adventure. His willingness to work with his brothers shows his natural leadership through inspiration rather than command.
keyActions: Creates the Gomu Gomu no Rocket slingshot to launch Ace
Enthusiastically suggests taking down the tiger together
quotes: Let's take down that tiger together!

characterSpotlights.development: Sabo's tactical mind is on display as he serves as the distraction during the tiger battle. The episode ends with ominous foreshadowing about his noble family finding him.
keyActions: Distracts the tiger during the battle
Works with his brothers to defeat the tiger

characterSpotlights.development: Naguri's backstory with Gol D. Roger is revealed, showing his honor and respect for worthy opponents. He serves as a temporary mentor to the three brothers.
keyActions: Shares his flashback about losing to Gol D. Roger
Teaches the boys about piracy while they build his ship

mangaDifferences.difference: Episode 499 is anime-only filler content. This entire episode, including Naguri's character and the tiger battle, does not appear in the manga.

trivia.fact: Episode 499 aired with a TV rating of 9.3%, ranking 5th for the week in Japan.
The episode preview for Episode 500 was shortened from its standard length.
Episodes 497-499 are rare pure filler episodes in One Piece, spending extra time with the three brothers before Episode 500 returns to canon material.

sources.title: One Piece – Post War Arc (Episodes 493 – 516) Review

trivia.fact: This episode features the combination attack technique where Luffy uses his rubber body as a slingshot to launch Ace, foreshadowing future combination attacks with the Straw Hat Pirates.
Naguri is an anime-only character who never appeared in the original manga. He was created specifically for these filler episodes to expand on the brothers' training.
The episode aired in Japan on May 22, 2011, but was simulcast on Funimation a day earlier on May 21, 2011.
